intro: Coccoloba nitida var. rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are typically rounded or elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
